weeks.title: Week 1 — The Frostforge: AWS + Terraform Foundations
weeks.goal: Set up AWS safely and provision baseline infra with Terraform.

days.title: Day 1 — Prepare the Realm (accounts + budget)
tasks: Create/choose a dedicated AWS account for the project
Enable MFA + set a monthly budget + cost alerts
Create an admin role/user strategy (write down what you chose and why)
Write docs: ‘How I secured this account’

days.title: Day 2 — Terraform Camp (state + structure)
tasks: Create repo structure: infra/terraform, apps, docs, runbooks
Run terraform fmt/validate and document commands
Commit baseline and tag a milestone (Week1-Day2)

days.title: Day 3 — Carve the Roads (VPC)
tasks: Provision VPC with public/private subnets across 2 AZs
Add NAT (single NAT is fine; document tradeoff)

days.title: Day 4 — Summon the Cluster (EKS)
tasks: Provision EKS cluster with managed node group
Write runbooks: ‘cluster access + basic kubectl checks’

days.title: Day 5 — Make it Repeatable (destroy/recreate)
tasks: Refactor Terraform into modules if needed (only if it improves clarity)
End-of-week review: what you learned + what to adjust

weeks.title: Week 2 — The First Keep: Deploy an App to EKS
weeks.goal: Deploy a boring app the right way (health checks, configs, ingress).

days.title: Day 6 — The Boring App (container + health)
tasks: Create a small Node API (+ optional tiny UI)
Build and run locally; document commands
Push code with a clean README section: local run

days.title: Day 7 — Helm Foundations
tasks: Create a Helm chart for the app
Deploy to cluster and verify rollout

days.title: Day 8 — Ingress (ALB) + Routing
tasks: Document common 502/503 causes + how you’d debug

days.title: Day 9 — DNS + (Optional) TLS
tasks: Create Route53 record for your app
(Optional) Add TLS via ACM or cert-manager
End-to-day: validate everything from a fresh device

days.title: Day 10 — Release Checklist
tasks: Do a ‘fake release’: change config + deploy
Document ‘what can go wrong’ + how you detect it
End-of-week review: gaps to fix next week

weeks.title: Week 3 — The Dragonshout: CI/CD that Looks Like Real Work
weeks.goal: Ship from GitHub to EKS safely, with no long-lived AWS keys.

days.title: Day 11 — CI Basics (PR checks)
tasks: Add GitHub Actions workflow: lint/test/build on PR
Add basic security scanning (Trivy or similar)
Document: what the pipeline checks and why

days.title: Day 12 — ECR + image publishing
tasks: Add workflow to build + push image on main

days.title: Day 13 — OIDC (no static AWS keys)
tasks: Configure GitHub OIDC provider in AWS
Update workflow to assume role via OIDC
Audit: ensure no long-lived AWS keys are used

days.title: Day 14 — CD to Kubernetes
tasks: Deploy to EKS via Helm in CI
Add a manual approval step for prod (optional)
Write docs/cicd.md describing the full flow
End-to-day: do a real code change and watch it deploy

days.title: Day 15 — Preview environments (optional but strong)
tasks: Document costs + when to use previews
Add a ‘how to test a PR deployment’ guide
End-of-week review: keep or drop preview envs

weeks.title: Week 4 — The Eye of Magnus: Observability
weeks.goal: Prove you can operate what you deploy.

days.title: Day 16 — Metrics stack
tasks: Create a dashboard: pod restarts, CPU/mem, node pressure

days.title: Day 17 — App metrics (basic)
tasks: Add basic request metrics to app (optional)
Add alert rules for obvious failures

days.title: Day 19 — Alert playbooks
tasks: Test: break one thing and follow your playbook
Refine docs based on what was missing

days.title: Day 20 — Harden and document
tasks: Review resource limits and autoscaling defaults
Consolidate docs into a clean table of contents
End-of-week review: where are you still shaky?

weeks.title: Week 5 — The Ashen Trial: Reliability + Failure Drills
weeks.goal: Show incident handling and reliability improvements.

days.title: Day 21 — Reliability basics
tasks: Tune rollout strategy for safe deploys
Document: scaling and what triggers it

days.title: Day 22 — Chaos drill #1 (pods)
tasks: Kill pods / delete deployment and observe recovery
Write postmortem: what happened, detection, fix

days.title: Day 23 — Chaos drill #2 (bad config)
tasks: Deploy a bad config and see impact

days.title: Day 24 — Troubleshooting guide
tasks: Write a troubleshooting section in README
Add quick kubectl commands cheat sheet

days.title: Day 25 — End-to-end demo run
tasks: Do a clean deploy from scratch (infra → app)

weeks.title: Week 6 — The Jarl’s Seal: Package for Hiring
weeks.goal: Turn your work into a narrative recruiters understand in 15 seconds.

days.title: Day 26 — CV bullets (evidence-based)
tasks: Write CV bullets mapping to your project evidence
Add keyword coverage (EKS, Terraform, OIDC, Helm)

days.title: Day 27 — LinkedIn + repo polish
tasks: Pin/feature the repo and demo video

days.title: Day 30 — Apply loop
tasks: Schedule 2 mock interviews with a friend or online

skillTree.name: Observability
skillTree.why: If you can’t see it, you can’t run it.

Hiring prep: README has a clear start-to-finish path
CV bullet points map to evidence
